page.title: 09Social Concerns - Poor Trust
page.content: The Trust was established in 1703 by the then vicar, Rev.Disney. On his death a committee of seven was set up to administer the Trust which has an annual income now of about one thousand pounds.The old school house, other property and gifts of money have been left to the Trust over the years. The property was sold off and the money invested. The Trust can help people and village organisations who fall on hard times but are not allowed to give any help to either the church or the chapel. Up to ten years ago working men who were in difficulty received a half a ton of coal at Christmas while widows received one ton of coal. When a death occurs in a family the Trust gives them one hundred pounds at Christmas.
